result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher E Mendez

records.addlTxt:
Final pre-trial on March 1, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on March 1, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on March 1, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial on March 16, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on September 30, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Back on the record at 11:18 a.m.  Atty Meyer-O'Day acknowledges rec. information.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalites.  Atty Meyer-O'Day stands mute.  Court enters not guilty plea(s) - set for trial.  Bond continued.  TSC to be set out about 60 days.

11:01 AM  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher E Mendez in court.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Christopher E Mendez.  Court states case and appearances.  State calls Officer Ian Carroll - BPD - S&T.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Meyer-O'Day does cross-exam.  Witness excused.  Atty Meyer-O'Day objects to bind over.  State makes argument.  Court finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Atty Meyer-O'Day would like to do ARGN today but notes the State told him they weren't prepared to do that.  Court will adjourn for 5 minutes to give the State time to prepare an information.  Recess at 11:12 a.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher E Mendez
Current: 134759 815 Franeconville Court, Poinciana, FL 34759 United States  (Effective: 07-22-2022)
Prior: 904 Moore St Lot 422, Baraboo, WI 53913

1:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher E Mendez not in court.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Christopher E Mendez.  Court notes Atty Meyer-O'Day contacted court prior to today's hearing indicating DE could not be here and requested DE be allowed to appear by phone or Zoom.  Court declined same.  State requests a warrant but does not object to a brief stay.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stays until July 28, 2022, at 11:00 a.m.  Court will abide any decision on cash bond.  Atty Meyer-O'Day updates DE's address.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
notice of witness list, and petition for leave to file additional motions

Adjustment Number: 22A 008924,
Payable Number: 252220,
Receipt Number: 22R 013196,
Amount: $20.00

2:35 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher E Mendez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day appeared by video for Christopher E Mendez.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Meyer-O'Day makes record re: representation - he's appearing for today's hearing only at this time.  Court notes there is a PDOAC in the file appointing Atty Markoski.  Court will address Atty Markoski at this hearing.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State makes bail argument - requests $500 cash bond w/conditions.  Atty's Markoski, Meyer-O'Day and DE have a breakout room.  Back on the record, Atty Markoski responds re: bail and will stay on the case until someone else files a notice of retainer - requests signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $100.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with K.R.H.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return date scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
